input_doc: I just purchased this KB for my 32gb 3G iPad. To my surprise it works great and at an excellent price!!! input_doc:
I love this playpen but more importantly........my dog loves this playpen. And my. Dog hates being confined but willingly goes into his playpen at night.....which is why I bought it (to break his habit of wanting to sleep with me or in my bedroom at all). Now he has a place all his own and it holds his very large pet bed, toys, and an overnight doggie guest, which we frequently have.
Product was super easy to put together and made of quality fabric too! I've recommended this item to all my friends with dogs!

I replaced a 640 gb 5400 RPM HD on my HP DV7-4270US laptop with this 7200 RPM and the process went smooth as silk. Since I used Win 7 backup and restore, I have to find a way to move the proprietary partitions so I can get the extra 110 GB onto my C: drive partition.

Quick, quiet, and, incredibly, uses less battery than the OEM drive... WD Black Scorpios, whether on the desktop or laptop are top of the line!!!

input_doc: I had bought an inexpensive wireless headphone set (12.95) to see how my late night TV viewing would go. They were "on ear" headphones and after 10 minutes, I loved the concept but my ears hurt! So, knowing that I would like wireless headphones, I shopped for "over the ear" headphones. I chose the Sennheiser RS 170's because of the base boost and the advertised long battery life. Not as much of a like to me was the surround sound except when it came to music. Pretty darn good! I am extremely happy with my purchase (though a tad pricy - but well worth it) and my son, who is an audiophyle told me they don't come any better!!! Thank you Sennheiser...

input_doc: If you're like me and don't want to deal with the hassle of charging your speakers and don't need them to be super portable, these are sooooo perfect.  For the price, I can't imagine finding many options that are as clear and loud.  I only listen at about 30% volume, and that's loud enough to fill my room. It's still clear up to about 75 to 80% -- around then, you won't get the bass sound you desire if you're blasting rap, but honestly, that much is too loud for me. I'm old. These are great. Buy them.

input_doc: I bought a new $1,300 laptop.  The cover did not go on easily.  I pushed on it lightly to attach it to my brand new Yoga laptop, and the Yoga Screen Cracked.  Spent hours on the phone with Lenova to find out that the screen is not covered under the warranty.  It will now cost me $400-$500 to replace the screen on my two day old laptop.  Why would a product be offered that will crack a screen?  I am sooooooo upset.  My daughter now needs to start college without a new laptop because a screen takes 3 weeks to fix.

input_doc:
It's been six months, and I've barely used this USB.
Now that I backed up important items on it, and took it for the weekend. It simply crashed!
Windows Disk Utility is the only one that recognized it, assigns a drive letter, but show as 0bytes. All data is lost. Unable to format or take any action.
Mac doesn't recognize, and lets you do any action.

I am extremely frustrated. I though that PNY provides quality product.

Do not purchase!!!!

input_doc: Great Product and Great Price! Saved me from paying the "Geniuses" (eye roll) at the apple store $180 to replace my hard drive. I used this cable to replace the original on my 13" MacBook Pro Unibody a1278 mid 2012. Fit perfectly and was relatively easy to instal. Before my computer endlessly indexed, making sooooo slow that it was unusable and all those processes running would eat up the battery so fast that the computer would die within one or two hours of being unplugged. Apple Store "Geniuses" (eye roll) tested it and said the hard drive was broken and needed to be replaced. I figured it could just be the cable that wore out and decided to try the $12 fix first. Now the computer is back to normal operation and I can finally edit all the projects I'm behind on!

input_doc:
The Samsung tablet I bought this case for is already a rare item in my country, so, I had to order the case from America. It is a replacement for another case I bought here in Colombia for pretty much the same price. However, The fintie case is way better. Waaaay better. It's sturdier despite its being smaller, my tablet turns on and off pretty quickly just by opening and closing the case, taking the s-pen in and out of the tablet is very comfortable, and working with an accesory keyboard is very comfortable when I fold the cover.

UPDATE: A month, and exactly as described by other customers, my case is already cracked on the corners despite a very light use. It is a good design in other aspects such as artwork, but it's totally ruined by a very poor choice of materials.

input_doc: This is the first top notch camera I have ever purchased.  IT is easy to use and easy to read the instructions.  My purchase through Amazon was very easy and quick, plus the cost was the best. It took 4 days to get my camera and then I was sooo excited.  I took it to Yosemite this weekend and took over 400 pictures. I think the screen is very easy to see.  And I have rechargeable batteries, which last about 100 pictures.  I also purchased a SDHC 4MB memory card which will hold over 1700 pictures. I would buy this camera again.  I am very happy!!!

input_doc: I have had this camera for 3 weeks now and it is great.  I am using it as a petcam for my dogs while away from my house and so far it has been wonderful. input_doc:
This is my first SLR camera... so I won't be able to compare this camera with other SLR camera.  But I am able to say that if you were to buy a camera this would be a great choice.  The quality of the Picture is much greater than point and shoot.  You have more control on how your pictures  turn out.  The Minolta HTsi plus is easy to use for the basic features, but  if you want to use the advance feature.... reading the manuel is  recommended, but don't worry. (  )
Pros:  Design, and easy to use.
Cons: Can't print date on pictures.

input_doc: If you are looking to actually enjoy the hands-free calling, don't buy this product. I read the reviews before i one bought and only one person commented on the hands-free and they said it was good. Trust me, its not. Probably if the MIC was remote and attaches to a cord it would be better but even when im within inches of the radio my callers still could not hear me. A couple of people said it sounded like i was going in and out of cell coverage, and those were the better comments. The audio quality was awful also, i didn't realize it until i returned this radio and purchased a  Pioneer AVH-280BT, difference in audio and bluetooth quality is night and day. For the added $70 bucks it was well worth it. This radio cost $103, i really got what i paid for. The Pioneer was $170 and was well worth it. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!

input_doc:
When the product arrived at my house, I connected to my HDMI and my Nexus 7 ( 2013), but couldn't see anything on TV.
Therefore, I asked for a return and specified the reason, immediately, I got a very polite response on the second day asking if I connect to a HDMI 1.4 cable.  (It's my bad that I didn't notice the product did specify that it needs a HDMI 1.4 cable).  So I then ordered HDMI 1.4 cable from Amazon.  After I connected to the new HDMI 1.4 cable, I have no problem to watch mirror image
from Nexus 7 onto the HDTV, which I am very happy.  However, I also tried the power charging adapter but it didn't really charge. So I wrote another email to them, I got the reply on the second day apologizing to me about the product and shipped me the replacement immediately.  The new one works quite well with the power charging. Their service is a 5 star service!!! Very courteous and effective!!

input_doc: All good.  Battery last a looooooong time.  Sound is very decent for price and size.  Only criticism is that top controls are a bit hard to see as they are  molded from the same black plastic as the unit itself.

I've reallly enjoyed this case. The keyboard is better than others I've tried. It has all of the keys separately--no using the "a" key as the "shift" as well. Easy to connect and charge. The part that holds the ipad is a little akward at first, but I've gotten use to it and really like it. I also like that I can fold the ipad over the keyboard to use as a tablet and not worry about touching the keys. Great product.

input_doc: I bought a SD1100 a year ago and very happy with it. This A1100 is a big disappointment. Picture quality is poor even at 12MP. When transfer to the computer for a larger view, all the grain shows up even with the flash. Second, it's TOOOO SLOOOOW, 3-5 seconds between each shot regardless of which resolution chosen: 1M, 2M 3M, etc. These shots were taken with the included 128MB SD card so one can rule out the card incompatibility. Battery life is terrible. After taking only around 20 pictures using the alkaline Panasonic batteries that came with the camera, the low battery indicator started flashing.

input_doc: Works great and was able to use with my HP Steam/8.1 laptop. I did have to download a DVD player drive from a 3rd party but it works amazing! Great for the price!!!!
GREAT quality!! Need a cord to replace the one that came with your device, look no further!!! The short ones are great for purse-charging from a spare battery!

I received my speaker three days ago. They came in a small neat box. It took less then 30 seconds to get them set up. They work great. The sound quality is amazing for the price. They are a sleek design and take up little desk space which is incredibly important because i am a neat freak. I bought a audio splitter so now i can play the music i have on my computer on my ipod dock. I would recommmend it to anyone who wants an inexpensive but durable and good sounding speakers

input_doc: I gave this only four stars because it did not do what I needed: Get my IBM Model M working with a Black Box KVM. It does seem to be working OK with a Northgate OmniKey/102 (Another old clicky PS/2 keyboard.) However I am seeing a lot of letters doubled so it may not be working well there either. input_doc: Does NOT work with Garmin Nuvi 2699!!! Trying to find a power solution for charging in the house. input_doc:
I've only had this a few days, but my initial impressions are very positive.

Basically it does everything you would expect it to do.  Power it on, connect to your computer, load it with content, download the app, set your device's wi-fi connection to connect to the wi-drive, start the app...and that's it.

Within the first hour - the USB connection for pushing content to it is sloooooow - I had an iphone, ipod touch and my Kindle Fire streaming 3 different movies perfectly well.

What I especially liked on the Kindle is you get a list of the movies!!  No more guessing with that stupid, idiotic Gallery view in the Kindle App that only shows you thumbnails and forces you to guess the movie!

It's not a full, true, wi-fi connection - so I couldn't get it to stream well from 50 feet away - but since you'll likely be sitting right next to it, you should be fine.

Battery life is actually going to be the limitation at around 4 hours (I believe), but checkout other reviews as people have discovered a workaround to get it to charge whilst streaming (which it doesn't want to do natively).

input_doc: I've been in the market for headphones ever since Walmart and Target have been making a big deal about selling earbugs that have to be jammed into your ear. Not a huge fan. Anyways, my partner referred me to these after she saw me hovering over some Beats by Dre, saying these were hands down a better deal and quality. Welp. I don't exactly know if she's wrong, buuut these definitely didn't leave my wallet crying. I love the sound quality of these, and so far as everyone says, the only down side has been the extremely long cord that is a nightmare during GYM use. But, given the price, and quality, I don't really see these losing a star over that. My partner seems to like it as I've already walked in on her dancing around the room with these bad boys - guess that long cable is useful to some people afterall.

input_doc: I put it in a 06' ridgeline.  Nice enough to round out sound, small enough to stay hidden behind the rear seat.  Perfect for my needs.  I actually tried a custom 700watt sub, and this is waaayy more practical. Keeping the vehicle's stock functionality and storage is way better. I still may make a custom cabinet at some point to hide back there, but I was just looking to not lose separation, when upgrading the head unit.  A lot cheaper too. Occasionally it's thumpy, usually it's just fine at the levels I use.

input_doc:
I've purchased a few of these and am back to purchase a few more to expand the lighting here.  This is a must have for off-grid-ders.  I'm getting old and the notion that if I might forget to turn off some lights that my entire energy supply could be drained (or worse) is not desirable.  I've strategically placed the censors to my liking (took weeks actually, since I'm not always in the areas where they are placed.  The LED strip lighting connects to the output and the input is connected directly to our battery bank (without a fuse works fine for me).
*Out of stock.  I hope when they come back in stock that they are identical as the last ones....working perfectly here and so cool (when I open the door to the 3-car garage a light comes on....and every step toward the other end of the garage opens another led strip light....they go off after sensing no motion for as many minutes as you allocate on the adjustable duration dial).

input_doc: I returned this back to Amazon. Why??? Because I do not feel that it is right that you pay so much for an Apple product and then they continue to control how the item is used. input_doc: ok sso I bought this amp for the power and the price. And its good in both of thoughs fields but from the moment i pluged it in it played a very loud feed back over my four speekers and not just a little bit, it was LOUD, i couldn't even turn it on a night because the people in the next room could hear the T.V. over the sound of the feed back. I called pyle and asked them to replace or fix my amp, they did... once i payed for shipping both ways 60$!!!!! and then when i finally got it back....2 weeks latter there was no change still the same feed back!!!!!!! Pyle is a good bargan company and i like their speeker components but don't buy an amp from  them, you'll regret it, and if its broken you might not want to bother returning it or getting a refund, their customer service SUCKS!!! stay away folks... if your looking for some power while still staying inside a budget try technical pro.

input_doc:
I like this laptop, really i do, i just have some minor complaints due Microsoft Crappy Vista and the bloatware that Acer includes in this model, but the machine overall is good and well for less than us$ 500. A lot of hard drive ( i suppose they're offering so much of it because all of the programs that comes with it), a lot of memory etc.

Well this is a good laptop, would be better if:

a) The Operating system was other that Windows Vista ( that's a crap of an OS) Vista has failed i don't know HOW many times since i bought this laptop.
b) If this model didn't bring a ton of bloatware, and when i say a ton i MEAN IT!, a lot of games and crappy programs that you won't EVER use in your life.
c) This SHOULD come with the installing cds but NOOOO Acer had the good idea to leave that to you ( I've tried to make my backup twice and burning the second cd the operation failed) --> that's worrisome.
d) I don't like the surface of the laptop, it gets a lot of fingerprints.
e) The heat can get a little uncomfortable if you have it by say ummm 2 hours on your lap.

input_doc: I purchased this laptop for my parents who only need a computer for email and browsing the internet. At first, I was very impressed with the fast startup time, very light unit, doesn't get hot, etc.....After a bit of use though, i had problems connecting to their wifi. I would get it connected and then the next day they would say it lost the connection, even though other devices would stay connected (it was not a network issue). In the end, I ended up returning this machine for this reason AND mostly because it is soooo small and compact that it's not suited for folks of my parents' age. The screen and icons are very tiny, they could not function well with such a small display. I might have pushed them to suffer through this had it not been for the connectivity problem (I googled it, it's a recurring issue with this machine). I got them a Dell with a 15.6 inch screen and they are much happier (and it stays connected).

input_doc:
I have tried Soooooooo many of these; Some, the tip would not pick up and when u press harder , it wouldn't slide; the tip would have too much rubber and it would come off and it would just bend weird, not giving me a comfortable feeling. I ordered this one because the picture showed a different tip on the stylus than the one I am used to. The tip is actually the same as other styluses, BUT, this one is WAY more responsive, and for the size, it' very accurate and it requires very little pressure. It also slides on the screen quite nicely.

I have big hands so, the size is actually comfortable for me but not as practical as it could be but that's a minor gripe. For this price and all the benefits, this is the one to get, hands down!!!

input_doc: I purchased this little gem about 2 months ago instead of an IPOD, because it had the FM receiver option.  I have never owned or operated an MP3 player before, but I found this one to be extremely user-friendly. To load your music, you simply connect it to the Windows Media Player (software disk is included0, then just drag and drop your music files.  The battery life is unbelievably long -I've charged it maybe, twice?  And it is soooo cute! The only thing I think they could have added is a "sleep" function that would turn it off after awhile.  Other than that I love it!

input_doc: Basic case, I love the layout. fan works and is not too loud. I reallly like the way the hardrives mount on the side. Keeps the center of the case open for air flow. I have a Basic set up, one hard drive motherboard and cpu and psu. This is only slightly larger than the mAtx case which i also love. taller but not much deeper exactly what i wanted and cheap. Built a new computer for the kids to home work and surf the web with for under 170 with this case and could not be happier.  its sturdy when to gether but the thin walls allowed me to mod the case with tin snips for routing the cables away from the center  where i want nothing but airflow for my overclocked g3258. its simplistic perfection in my book, and on the cheap!

input_doc: I did alot of research before buying this and after several weeks bought the 605 30gb. I am happy with my purchase, but I would like to say that there are a few things you will need to realize before you buy this #1 I was confused about if this thing had a SD slot and it doesn't which was my own fault I didn't read the description better (the smaller one I think its like a 10gb not sure is the only one that has the SD slot #2 I bought mine to take on tripos and watch movies on and it works great (excellent picture and quailty) and after buying all the extra plug-ins was able to surf the web (now let me say this aint no laptop so if your buying exspecting the same speed as a laptop better save your money and buy one but if you are just looking to check your mail do alittle surffing and be able to slide it into your pocket after you got the best) #3 I would like to say that the customer sewrvice really SUCKS, and for the money you have to spend on this it seems like they would treat the customer better. #4My only real complaint with my 605 is thatthe battery is awful and since it isn't replacable that makes it a major problem (mine only last maybe 4-6 hours) I have to say I thought I might have made a mistake buying a 30gb but I have alot of music on mine and keep maybe 4-5 movies on at alll times but could easly have 30 if I wanted I just erase them after I get through and load on a new onefrom my desktop which is really easy (and I aint the most computer friendly person in the world). Oh one more thing the speakers?!?!?! Weeelllll lets just say it aint no bose sound system it is what it is a personal player and with the includede earbuds it works great but if you are going to trey and use it as a sterio you won't be happy unless you get that thing archs has you can set the unit into and plug up to that has built in speakers, my next purchase is gonna be a DVR staion I am waiting a few months for the new to ware off so I can get a refurbished or atleast alittle better price. Good luck with your decission and I hope I helped you alittle ans sorry about the misspelled words.

input_doc: I was surprised by the ease of use in this camcorder. The 78x Zoom is really nice, it covers a lot of ground. As to other review on this camcorder, you don't have to hook up this camcorder with a cable, most computers have a slot to put in an SD card to transfer the video onto the computer, hmmmmm, can't believe the other reviewer doesn't have that. The standard def is all the quality I need, I'm not a journalist so high def is not needed. I went to [...] and got "convert any video" software to convert the movie file on this camera to a smaller size for ease of sharing my movies. I bought this camera when it was priced more and am still glad I got it!

input_doc: LOVE IT! I use it for weddings! input_doc:
Quality is fine especially once window is small.

You need a line-in option under your sound settings and many Dell laptops don't have this and it won't work with them.

Installing is ok but support is terrible but then again so is Dell. Dell took 4-5 hours before they believed there was no line-in and then told me to get lost.... and they're world class.

input_doc: This TV is great, it's my 3rd samsung i've purchased and definitely the best, I bought one of the earlier LED TV samsungs and they are great but the interface on this newer model is amazing. It's sooo easy to use, the build quality is like German engineering, even the remote exudes German quality even though it's from Korea. I think Samsung have taken quality build to the next level with this product. It isn't kitchy, it's quality, love it highly recommended. I thought of buying the more expensive ones but this one is perfect, i've not a 50/60/75hz or whatever it is snob, the picture quality is AMAZING and unlike the older Samsung LED TV's the sound quality is superb. Samsung have really hit a home run with this TV.

input_doc: Started really working out about 4 months ago, and realized just how much I sweat. Never really liked the cheap white earbuds that came with my ipod to begin with, but once I started working out I noticed they don't like sweat, cutting out, falling out, being uncomfortable, etc. So I thought I'd give these a try. Well worth the money. They sound great, way better then those tin can sounding, little, hard white things. They hold up to my sweaty workout routines, they fit nice, and come with different sized plastic dealies for different sized earholes (yea I said earhole). Not to mention they sound waaaaaaay better than what I'm used to. All in all, unless your an audiofile freak who needs perfect concert sound. These little babies are pretty sweet.
